root.name: for
root.description:
Controls a sequence of repetitions. A for structure has three parts: init, test, and update. Each part must be separated by a semicolon (;). The loop continues until the test evaluates to false. When a for structure is executed, the following sequence of events occurs:

1. The init statement is executed.
2. The test is evaluated to be true or false.
3. If the test is true, jump to step 4. If the test is false, jump to step 6.
4. Execute the statements within the block.
5. Execute the update statement and jump to step 2.
6. Exit the loop.

In the first example above, the for loop is executed 40 times. In the init statement, the value i is created and set to zero. i is less than 40, so the test evaluates as true. At the end of each loop, i is incremented by one. On the 41st execution, the test is evaluated as false, because i is then equal to 40, so i < 40 is no longer true. Thus, the loop exits.

parameter.label: init
parameter.description: statement executed once when beginning loop

parameter.label: test
parameter.description: if the test evaluates to true, the statements execute

parameter.label: update
parameter.description: executes at the end of each iteration

parameter.label: statements
parameter.description: collection of statements executed each time through the loop
